info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 9:10PM EDT until June 19 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Buffalo NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to impact Livingston County, especially in the towns of Lima, Avon, and Geneseo.
* WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following counties, Livingston and Monroe.
* WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Geneseo, Letchworth State Park, Avon, Mount Morris, Honeoye Falls, Conesus, Caledonia, Lima, Scottsville, Hemlock, Mendon, Rush, York, Livonia, Leicester, Lakeville, South Lima, Industry and Mumford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT THURSDAY
